posts.content:
Does Whirlwind Attack ignore Displacement?

I was doing some WA against some Displacer Beasts, and I noticed that there weren't any misses being reported due to Displacement.

So does anyone know if WA ignores this?

Would be another cool feature of this combat feat.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I don't know the answer to that, and the wiki doesn't help, but I do know that Whirlwind Attack can be used to attack unseen enemies in range.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
We can't be certain of the answer, but I have a feeling that Whirlwind does indeed work against displaced opponents.

Further testing is needed of course.

I think it is safe to say that WA ignores displacement!

Test Toon was a 40th level Character with a very high AB to filter out misses (only a 1 misses in this case).  No recorded misses due to Displacement here.

One thing I will add - WA is really, really bad vs Enlarged Opponents (meaning those that have been enlarged with the toolset) - missing them entirely whereas attacking normally does not.  I suppose this is where IWA is much better, but the Prereq is meh (23 Dex).  Might be something to look into for a Dex based WM, however.

I think, upon using WA more now on WoG, that perhaps it's Reputation should be upgraded to a pretty useful feat - lt basically makes one immune to Sneaks, Flanking, hits invisible, including Greater Sanctuary hidden foes, and more importantly imo ignores Displacement, all at highest AB on surrounding opponents.

That's pretty useful in my book!
